item.title: Updated grahams event manager
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Advocatus, post:27, topic:389540”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=485453.msg4025175#msg4025175 date=1340290168]

Just use ticks as hyperion has.

You are obviously retarded.

  1. Hyperion doesnt come with a tick system.
  2. The purpose of this was to be a useful update for the traditionally used event manager (which graham had originally released years ago). This event manager is quite horrid for obvious reasons.
    [/quote]‘obviously retarded’ for suggesting a better system (citing the wrong source?), wow you should shut the fuck up

No, he is obviously retarded for not bothering to think before typing. You also made that same mistake, so honestly you should just shut the fuck up.
Graham’s latested released tick system (which is also present in Apollo) is significantly different from his initial event manager in a few key places.

  1. His initial event manager ran on a seperate thread. His later “TaskManager” ran on the same thread as the game logic processing.
  2. His initial event manager used one collection for all “Events”, this had to be synched with for adding/ removing events because the event manager utilized multiple threads.

Just to make some final clarifications:
By saying “initial evet manager” I do not refer to the one released in rs2hd or final devolution 2.7. I refer to the one used in nearly every single winterlove source.
I am not trying to say that “Tick” systems are worthless, because I believe otherwise.
However, the point of this appears to be a quick and easy to implement (literally just replace the file) system that corrected some of the problems that graham had fixed with his later releases.[/quote]since you’re using the term retarded in such a loose, ironically ‘retarded’, way to refer to your distaste of someone’s unwillingness to check facts and/or just your general distaste through ignorant egotism. better still, you’ve actually clarified a bit more now though, now we actually understand that you’ve gutted the better system (which wasn’t particularly obvious). although why not just spend time on a system that replaces this crap with something that solves the various problems with this ‘event manager’ and then insist that it’s better.

Read full topic

item.title: Updated grahams event manager
item.dc:creator: @Advocatus Advocatus
item.description:
@Advocatus wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:15, topic:389540”][quote author=Advocatus link=topic=485453.msg4024666#msg4024666 date=1340245148]

Just use ticks as hyperion has.

You are obviously retarded.

  1. Hyperion doesnt come with a tick system.

  2. The purpose of this was to be a useful update for the traditionally used event manager (which graham had originally released years ago). This event manager is quite horrid for obvious reasons.
    [/quote]‘obviously retarded’ for suggesting a better system (citing the wrong source?), wow you should shut the fuck up[/quote]
    No, he is obviously retarded for not bothering to think before typing. You also made that same mistake, so honestly you should just shut the fuck up.
    Graham’s latested released tick system (which is also present in Apollo) is significantly different from his initial event manager in a few key places.

  3. His initial event manager ran on a seperate thread. His later “TaskManager” ran on the same thread as the game logic processing.

  4. His initial event manager used one collection for all “Events”, this had to be synched with for adding/ removing events because the event manager utilized multiple threads.

Just to make some final clarifications:
By saying “initial evet manager” I do not refer to the one released in rs2hd or final devolution 2.7. I refer to the one used in nearly every single winterlove source.
I am not trying to say that “Tick” systems are worthless, because I believe otherwise.
However, the point of this appears to be a quick and easy to implement (literally just replace the file) system that corrected some of the problems that graham had fixed with his later releases.

Read full topic
